comments:
When the repository configuration has changed (e.g. a version was added) and queries are synchronized an error is displayed: "No version with name 'x.y.z' found". 

Mylar should attempt to update the repository (or project) configuration and only display an error when that fails.

+1.  Might not make 2.0 though.

Can we do something easy and manual for now, e.g. adding a "Refresh Attributes from server" button to the Attributes section, right on the section title?  That's nice because it's in-line with where you are looking when you notice an attribute missing.

That won't help since the error is displayed when synchronizing changes and not when the editor is opened. 

The error message should at least give the user a hint to fix the problem.

+1

But for Bugzilla the more common case for me has been that I want to see an attribute that's missing when I'm looking at the Attributes section.

I'll start collecting stack traces so we know where to fix this:
